Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3Part2.text: Speak if you can. What are you?

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: First Witch
Act1Scene3Part2.text: All hail, Macbeth! Hail to thee, Thane of Glamis!

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: Second Witch
Act1Scene3Part2.text: All hail, Macbeth! Hail to thee, Thane of Cawdor!

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: Third Witch
Act1Scene3Part2.text: All hail, Macbeth, that shalt be king hereafter!

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3Part2.text: Macbeth, good sir, why do you start and seem to fear? Things that do sound so fair?
Act1Scene3Part2.translation: How could you be scared by such good fortune?

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3Part2.text: My noble partner You greet with present grace and great prediction of noble having and of royal hope. That he seems rapt withal.
Act1Scene3Part2.translation: Macbeth, you seem completely absorbed by the idea of wealth and royal power.

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: Banquo
Act1Scene3Part2.text: To me you speak not. If you can look into the seeds of time And say which grain will grow and which will not. Speak, then, to me, who neither beg nor fear
Act1Scene3Part2.translation: Talk to me dawg, I ain't scared of you.

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: First Witch
Act1Scene3Part2.translation: You will have less power and wealth than Macbeth Banquo, but do far greater in other ways.

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: Second Witch
Act1Scene3Part2.text: Not so happy, yet much happier.

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: Third Witch
Act1Scene3Part2.text: Thou shalt get kings, though thou be none. All hail, Macbeth and Banquo!
Act1Scene3Part2.translation: You will never be king, but your descendants will be. All hail, Macbeth and Banquo!

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3Part2.text: You imperfect speakers, Tell me more! By Sinelâ€™s death I know I am Thane of Glamis, but how of Cawdor?
Act1Scene3Part2.translation: I know by my father's death that I am Thane of Glamis, but how can I be Thane of Cawdor when he is still alive?

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3Part2.text: The Thane of Cawdor lives! A prosperous gentleman, and to be king? Stands not within the prospect of belief, no more than to be Cawdor.
Act1Scene3Part2.translation: The Thane of Cawdor is still alive, and how can I be king? That's impossible!

Act1Scene3Part2.speaker: Macbeth
Act1Scene3Part2.text: Say from whence you owe this strange intelligence, or why upon this blasted heath you stop our way with such prophetic greeting. Speak, I charge you.
Act1Scene3Part2.translation: Tell me where you got this strange knowledge, or why you are standing here blocking our path with such prophetic words. Speak, I command you.
